title: How to Torrent Games With a BitTorrent Client

steps.title: Understand the risks associated with torrenting.
steps.content: Understand the risks associated with torrenting. While any file can be torrented, it's usually associated with pirating software. Downloading a game isn't illegal, but sharing it is. By uploading, or seeding, a game, you may make yourself vulnerable to a lawsuit from the copyright holder of the game you're downloading. [2] X Research source If you're caught downloading games using BitTorrent, you might receive a warning letter from your ISP. In that case, it would be best to stop. Continuing will put you at risk of having your internet service disconnected and you might also face charges for copyright infringement. [3] X Research source Downloading torrent files can also give you a virus or malware. As long as you're careful about where you download your torrent files from and use a VPN and antivirus software, torrenting is usually quite safe.

steps.title: Download a BitTorrent client.
steps.content: Download a BitTorrent client. There are a number of BitTorrent clients available for download. Which one you use comes down to personal preference, but make sure to choose a well-known BitTorrent client to avoid downloading malware. qBittorrent is a highly recommended client by many Reddit users. [4] X Research source Other recommended options include Transmission and Deluge. BitTorrent and uTorrent are some older options and used to be some of the best. However, many Reddit users do not recommend these clients anymore as they are adware and have some safety concerns. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Install the BitTorrent client on your computer.
steps.content: Install the BitTorrent client on your computer. Once you've downloaded the torrent client you want to use, open the installation file and follow the installation instructions to install it on your computer. Each torrent may have a slightly different installer, but each one has a setup wizard that will walk you through how to install the client.

steps.title: Use a search engine to find a torrent file for the game you want to download.
steps.content: Use a search engine to find a torrent file for the game you want to download. In order to use a torrent client, you'll need a .torrent file. You can use a search engine to search for specific file types. On Google, type filetype:torrent and then the name of the game you want to download. To avoid malicious ads and malware, two recommended sites are 1337x.to and FitGirl Repacks. [6] X Research source If you're using qBittorrent, it has a built-in search to find torrent files. The filetype:torrent search works on other search engines like Bing, Yahoo!, and DuckDuckGo.

steps.title: Click on one of the search result links.
steps.content: Click on one of the search result links. Torrent sites often have a lot of pop-up ads and ads that may be inappropriate for children. Torrent sites are also often being shut down due to copyright violations and not all of the links will work. Torrent websites often list the number of seeders for each torrent file. According to Martinez, seeders are the people currently uploading parts of the torrent file.

steps.title: Download the torrent file.
steps.content: Download the torrent file. It's recommended to use a VPN for safety. Also, be sure to scan any files you download with antivirus software like Malwarebytes to ensure they are safe.

steps.title: Open your torrent client.
steps.content: Open your torrent client. A torrent file doesn't actually include the game that you wanted to download. It essentially tells your computer where to go on the internet to find bits and pieces of that file, which it will download and combine once all the parts are downloaded.

steps.title: Open the torrent file you downloaded.
steps.content: Open the torrent file you downloaded. Depending on your torrent client, you can often click and drag the torrent file into the torrent client window to open the file. You can also use the File menu to open the torrent file. Double-clicking the torrent file will also often open the torrent file in your torrent client.

steps.title: Start downloading the file.
steps.content: Start downloading the file. Most torrent clients won't start downloading the file until you manually start it. Click the torrent file to select it, and then click the start transfer button. It usually looks like a play arrow button. When the file starts downloading, you'll see how many people you're downloading the file from, and how many people you're uploading it to. The more people uploading, or seeding, the file, the faster it will download. When the file is done downloading, you can continue to seed the file by leaving your torrent client open. Seeding means you are now one of the sources for a part of that file. Game files can come in many different file formats for different computers. Make sure you're downloading the right version of the game for your computer's operating system.
